Microorganisms such as the genera Aspergillus, Fusarium, and Penicillium are responsible for food poisoning and food-borne infections that can also deteriorate foods and increase the cost of agricultural production, and health care. 5, 6 In addition, the genera Trichoderma, Aspergillus and Penicillium, known as green molds, occur on mushroom production when the composting is not correctly prepared and/or does not become selective enough.
